title: Training in brain injury rehabilitation.
abstract:
Purpose: To evaluate our current training programme for\ud
professionals involved in brain injury rehabilitation, which\ud
involves disability simulation, and to consider the ethics and\ud
consequences of such programmes.\ud
Method: Seventy-two professionals took part in a brain injury\ud
disability simulation exercise and completed questionnaires pre\ud
and post the workshop.\ud
Results: Results suggest that participants have increased\ud
insight into the challenges faced by people with brain injuries.\ud
Conclusions: We believe that brain injury simulation exercises\ud
help professionals increase their understanding of the impairments\ud
and disabilities that may follow brain injury and can\ud
therefore form an important part of a training programme for\ud
rehabilitation staff
